newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: SHARES GAIN, FOLLOW HERMIS, VILNIAUS BANKS.
newsitem.headline: SHARES GAIN, FOLLOW HERMIS, VILNIAUS BANKS.

text.p: * Vilniaus Bank advances to 228.00 litas from 220.00 litas.
* Hermis Bank marches up to 190.00 litas from 188.00 litas.
* Medienos Plaushas falls to 11.50 litas from 12.50 litas.
* KLASCO edges up to 11.81 litas from 11.50 litas.
* Brokers say gains in Hermis and Vilniaus signal some
Market favourites Hermis and Vilniaus banks brought a glimmer of optimism in morning trading at the depressed Lithuanian bourse on Thursday.
Brokers say shares should hold steady or show slight increases by the end of the week.
"The market looks good today...we've got 13 shares up and only five down," said one broker.
Brokers said leading bank shares Vilniaus Bank and Hermis Bank were acting as weather vanes for what optimism there was, on a bourse that has been sleepy and despondent.
Vilniaus Bank advanced to 228.00 litas from 220.00 litas. Hermis Bank marched up to 190.00 litas from 188.00 litas.
"The whole market feels active and as a consequence, Vilniaus Bank and Hermis Bank, which are always in a leading position, have reacted," one broker said.
In other official list trading, Medienos Plaushas fell to 11.50 litas from 12.50 litas. The drop followed a gain of about four percent Wednesday.
Brokers blamed today's fall in Medienos Plaushas on the price fixing mechanism and said they expected low turnover in the shares.
In group A shares, Lithuanian Gas, which weighs heavily on the index, stayed steady at 1.65 litas.
Klaipeda Stevedoring (KLASCO) edged up to 11.81 litas from 11.50 litas.
